I found qftest great for swing applications and uses jython.
It costs money though.
 

-----Original Message-----
From: twall@... [mailto:twall@...] 
Sent: Friday, December 10, 2004 7:33 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] testing 'Applets' using either htmlunit or jWebUnit


On 09.12.2004 13:21:35, Russell Gold <russgold@...> wrote:

>
>HttpUnit has some support for applets. I don't know whether jWebUnit
>exposes it. But applets are ultimately GUIs and suffer from the
>general difficulty of GUI testing.

Abbot (http://abbot.sf.net) has some built-in support for applet
testing, but things get tricky when you start looking at browser/applet
interaction.  Empirix has a commercial solution to address that area.
